data.title: Charles Durning Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Charles Durning with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Left home at 16

Enlisted in the Army and landed on Normandy on D-Day; also fought in the Battle of the Bulge

Was awarded the Silver Star and three Purple Hearts for his combat duty

Before embarking on an acting career, worked as an usher in a burlesque house and taught ballroom dancing

Trained alongside Jason Robards, Colleen Dewhurst and Grace Kelly at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts

Is a former boxer

Married his childhood sweetheart, Mary Anne Amelio

Played Santa Claus at least five times in films

Received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2008

Awards

2008Emmy-Outstanding Guest Actor in a Drama Series: nominated

2005Emmy-Outstanding Guest Actor in a Drama Series: nominated

1992Emmy-Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series: nominated

1991Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series, Miniseries or Motion Picture Made for Television: winner

1986Emmy-Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Miniseries or Special: nominated

1984Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Motion Picture: nominated

1983Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role: nominated

1982Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role: nominated

1980Emmy-Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or Special: nominated

1977Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series, Miniseries or Motion Picture Made for Television: nominated

1977Emmy-Outstanding Single Performance by a Supporting Actor in a Comedy or Drama Series: nominated

1976Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Motion Picture: nominated

1975Emmy-Outstanding Lead Actor in a Special Program: nominated

1975National Board of Review-Best Supporting Actor: winner
